title: GreenThumb Monitor
description: A smart gardening system using Arduino to monitor soil moisture and environmental conditions for optimal plant health.
introduction: GreenThumb Monitor is an innovative project designed to help gardeners and plant enthusiasts maintain optimal growing conditions. By leveraging Arduino and sensor technology, this system provides real-time data on soil moisture, temperature, and light levels, ensuring plants receive the care they need to thrive.

sections.title: Motivation
sections.body: As an avid gardener, I often struggled with overwatering and underwatering my plants. This led to the idea of creating a system that could monitor soil conditions and provide actionable insights. The motivation was to build a tool that could help anyone, regardless of their gardening experience, keep their plants healthy and thriving.

sections.title: Prototype Development
sections.body: The initial prototype used an Arduino Uno, soil moisture sensors, and LED indicators. The system was designed to be simple yet effective, providing visual feedback on soil conditions. Challenges included calibrating the sensors for accuracy and ensuring the system was user-friendly.

sections.title: Adding Environmental Sensors
sections.body: To enhance functionality, I integrated temperature and light sensors. This allowed the system to provide a more comprehensive view of the plant's environment. The challenge was synchronizing data from multiple sensors and ensuring accurate readings.

sections.title: Data Logging and Alerts
sections.body: I implemented a data logging feature using an SD card module to store historical data. Additionally, I added alerts for critical conditions, such as low moisture levels or extreme temperatures. This required programming the system to handle data storage and notifications effectively.

sections.title: Final Touches and Testing
sections.body: The final phase involved refining the user interface and testing the system in real-world conditions. I encountered challenges with sensor durability and power management, which were resolved by using waterproof sensors and optimizing the power supply. The system was tested with various plant species to ensure its versatility.
